description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Objectives****:** This course is designed to support college freshmen in their use of **English language in academic context** and to improve their reading, writing, speaking, and listening abilities through activities that integrate the four language skills. The objectives of this class include developing students’ (1) **effective English reading skills**, (2) **improved fluency** in expressing ideas **in oral and written forms in English**, and (3) **autonomous self-study skills** using technologies such as computers and internet. In order to do so, there a four-pronged approach to the course:

**1) Firstly,** the **course textbook and online practice website** emphasize vocabulary learning and building in order to provide students the structure and tools to acquire new words. There is also a purposefully structured skills and strategies program to propel language learning and create independent learners. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve reading proficiency and develop practical critical thinking.

**2) Secondly,** students will undertake **two group task-based projects**, in which task groups of no more than 4 students per group.  The first group project is a movie review oral presentation and the second project is creating, writing, and filming their own short movie no longer than 5 minutes in duration.  Students will change project teams after the first project so that they can meet and make friends with other students in the class.

**3) Thirdly,** the course will teach in class **Activity-Based Tasks** and **Mini Projects**, which are almost entirely completed during class time.  There might be some simple follow-on steps necessary for the student to enter results into their computer and upload, but the bulk of the activity will all be done during class.  The purpose of these Activity-Based Tasks and Mini Projects is accomplish dual learning of both English and a useful skill. These activities are generally two-person teams and students will change teams after each task or mini project so that they can meet and make new friends with other students in the class.

**4) Finally**, students will practice their reading and writing skills by reading a high-level book and then writing a five-paragraph essay expressing their opinion about the novel.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Basics**

1.  **Punctual attendance** **please**. The 8:00 am class is difficult, I know. But please drag yourself out of bed and carry yourself to class on time.  It’s good for you and also respectful to your fellow classmates.  We will have “warm-up” exercises at the beginning of each class so please come on time.  Talk to or email me if you can’t attend class.
2.  This is a **Flip Class**. Prep work must be done for the class to work properly. This includes reviewing and previewing class chapters.
3.  **Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do assignments.
4.  **In class activities and in class mini projects** will be scored a **0** if you do not attend with an unexcused absence. For you own benefit, you need to attend class to avoid getting a 0 for this category.
5.  Smartphones, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
6.  Actively **participate in class discussions**. This is your time to talk and have enjoy speaking in a foreign language.  Don’t be shy.  Learning a foreign language requires participation, and participation makes the class fun for you!
7.  **What and Why**: When answering questions, please remember to answer with a “what” and a “why”.  The “what” is simply answering the question (what should the person do in this situation?), however, the “why” is much deeper – it is the explanation of your thought process.  The “why” answer is more interesting, more challenging, and if you can answer the “why” then your English will quickly improve.  I will often ask you “why”.
8.  **Have fun and make friends.**  We will switch groups very often so you can meet everyone in the class and make new friends.
9.  If another student asks you to temporarily exchange seats for an In-Class Activity or Mini Project, you must say **“Yes! Of course!”.** This facilitates classroom activities and maximizes everyone’s opportunity to meet and practice English with all the other students in the class.
10.  **I want everyone to succeed.**  Everyone who attends, arrives on time, tries their best, turns in all their assignments, and participates in class will easily pass this course.  No worries.
